fulfilment.translation[0].definitions[0]: the feeling of being happy and satisfied with your life because you are doing interesting, useful, or important things
Are you looking for greater fulfillment and satisfaction in your work?
a deep sense of fulfilment that makes life worthwhile
The real joy of the priesthood is helping people find personal fulfilment.
fulfilment.translation[0].definitions[1]: when something you wanted happens or is given to you
the fulfillment of a long-held dream
fulfilment.translation[0].definitions[2]: the act of doing something that you promised or agreed to do
People are wondering if they will ever see the fulfillment of the government’s campaign pledges.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[0]: fulfilment of a hope, promise etc is when the thing that you had hoped for, promised etc happens or is done
Receiving the award was the fulfillment of a life-long ambition.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[1]: the action of supplying the things that have been ordered
He ordered a stop to the unauthorized use of produce already allocated for fulfillment of state orders.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[2]: when you do in a satisfactory way the things that a contract says you must do
The clearing house guarantees fulfilment of all contracts by becoming a party to every transaction.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[3]: the action of reaching a standard that is necessary, especially one that has been officially decided
The offer of this contract is subject to the fulfilment of certain conditions.
The Bundesbank said that the fulfillment of conditions of economic convergence between EU countries should not be linked to a specific time frame.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[4]: an occasion when something that is wanted, needed etc happens or is given
The effective leader must perform two functions successfully, namely the achievement of the task which has been set and the fulfilment of colleagues’ needs.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[5]: when people, organizations, or machines do the things they must do or are expected to do
The fulfilment of the Bank’s public duty overrides its duty of confidence to their customers.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[6]: when you achieve what you were hoping to do
He focussed all the team’s efforts towards the fulfillment of strategic goals.
This aid money is crucial to the fulfilment of the government’s economic policies.
fulfilment.translation[1].definitions[7]: the feeling of being satisfied, especially in your job, because you are using all your skills and qualities
He gained great fulfillment from teaching and training others for the profession.
Working on a conveyor belt does little for a sense of personal fulfilment.
